maml:description.maml:para: Gets registered volume information
Gets information about the volumes that were registered using the Register-FsVolumeInfo command and are available to the Start-FsCrawlJob command.
Gets registered volume information for the volume that contains the specified path (wildcards accepted). Case-sensitivity is dependent upon the registered volume.
Gets registered volume information for the volume that contains the specified literal path. Case-sensitivity is dependent upon the registered volume.
Gets registered volume information that matches the specified full path name of the of the volume's root directory. Case-sensitivity is dependent upon the registered volume.
Gets registered volume information that matches the specified volume name. This is not case-sensitive.
Gets registered volume information that matches the specified volume UUID or VSN. For remote file shares, this should be the URN of the remote source. This is not case-sensitive.
Gets all registered volumes. This is the default behavior if no other parameters are used.
Gets registered volume information for the volume that contains the specified path (wildcards accepted). Case-sensitivity is dependent upon the registered volume.
Gets registered volume information for the volume that contains the specified literal path. Case-sensitivity is dependent upon the registered volume.
Gets registered volume information that matches the specified full path name of the of the volume's root directory. Case-sensitivity is dependent upon the registered volume.
Gets registered volume information that matches the specified volume name. This is not case-sensitive.
Gets registered volume information that matches the specified volume UUID or VSN. For remote file shares, this should be the URN of the remote source. This is not case-sensitive.
Gets registered volume information that matches the specified volume guid / serial number. This is not case-sensitive.
Gets all registered volumes. This is the default behavior if no other parameters are used.
Case-sensitive path name of the volume root directory to search for.
Describes the registered volume information:

maml:definition.maml:para: The absolute file URI of the the volume root directory.
The full path name of the volume root directory.
The name of the filesystem / format for the volume.
The unique identifier for the volume. This is an object which represents the UUID, VSN or remote path of the volume.

command:example.maml:title: Get registered volume that match any of the specified root path names.
Get registered volumes that match any of the specified volume names.
Get registered volume that matches the specified volume serial numbers.

maml:description.maml:para: Registers file system volume information
Register file system volume information to be used by the Start-FsCrawlJob command.
The full path name of the volume root directory.
The name of the file system volume.
The name of the drive format.
The volume UUID or VSN that will be used as the unique identifier for the file system volume. For remote file shares, this should be the URN of the remote source.
File name/path lookups are case-sensitive.
Return registered volume information object.
Updates volume info event if it has already been been registered. Also registers volume information even if the subdirectory does not exist.
The full path name of the volume root directory.
The name of the file system volume.
The name of the drive format.
The volume UUID or VSN that will be used as the unique identifier for the file system volume. For remote file shares, this should be the URN of the remote source.
File name/path lookups are case-sensitive.
Return registered volume information object.
Updates volume info event if it has already been been registered. Also registers volume information even if the subdirectory does not exist.
Returns the registered volume information if the PassThru switch is used.

maml:definition.maml:para: The absolute file URI of the the volume root directory.
The full path name of the volume root directory.
The name of the filesystem / format for the volume.
The unique identifier for the volume. This is an object which represents the UUID, VSN or remote path of the volume.

maml:alert.maml:para: Volume registration information is stored in-memory in the current session and is not persisted, otherwise.

command:example.maml:title: Register volume info using volume and return volume information object.

maml:description.maml:para: Un-registers file system volume information
Un-registers file system volume information so it is no longer available to the Start-FsCrawlJob command.
The full path name of the root directory for the volume to un-register. Case-sensitivity is dependent upon the volume registration.
Return the IVolumeInfo object of the un-registered volume.
The volume UUID or VSN to un-register. This is not case-senstive.
Return the IVolumeInfo object of the un-registered volume.
The volume information object to un-register.
Return the IVolumeInfo object of the un-registered volume.
The full path name of the root directory for the volume to un-register. Case-sensitivity is dependent upon the volume registration.
The volume UUID or VSN to un-register. This is not case-senstive.
The volume information object to un-register.
Return the IVolumeInfo object of the un-registered volume.
Returns the un-registered volume information if the PassThru switch is used.

maml:definition.maml:para: The absolute file URI of the the volume root directory.
The full path name of the volume root directory.
The name of the filesystem / format for the volume.
The unique identifier for the volume. This is an object which represents the UUID, VSN or remote path of the volume.

command:example.maml:title: Un-register volume info using the volume's root path.
Un-register volume info using the volume serial number.
Un-register volume info using a volume information object.

maml:description.maml:para: Starts file system crawl job.
Starts a background job that gathers file system content information.
Starting directory of the path to be crawled (supports wildcards).
The machine-specific unique identifier which identifies the current host system.
Maximum crawl depth. Default is 512.
Maximum items to crawl. Default is 4,294,967,295.
Job does not expire automatically.
Optional job name.
Starting directory of the path to be crawled (supports wildcards).
The machine-specific unique identifier which identifies the current host system.
Maximum crawl depth. Default is 512.
Maximum items to crawl. Default is 4,294,967,295.
The number of minutes to allow crawl to run.
Optional job name.
Starting directory of the path to be crawled (supports wildcards).
The machine-specific unique identifier which identifies the current host system.
Maximum crawl depth. Default is 512.
Maximum items to crawl. Default is 4,294,967,295.
The date/Time when crawl will be stopped if it has not already completed.
Optional job name.
Literal starting directory of the path to be crawled.
The machine-specific unique identifier which identifies the current host system.
Maximum crawl depth. Default is 512.
Maximum items to crawl. Default is 4,294,967,295.
Job does not expire automatically.
Optional job name.
Literal starting directory of the path to be crawled.
The machine-specific unique identifier which identifies the current host system.
Maximum crawl depth. Default is 512.
Maximum items to crawl. Default is 4,294,967,295.
The number of minutes to allow crawl to run.
Optional job name.
Literal starting directory of the path to be crawled.
The machine-specific unique identifier which identifies the current host system.
Maximum crawl depth. Default is 512.
Maximum items to crawl. Default is 4,294,967,295.
The date/Time when crawl will be stopped if it has not already completed.
Optional job name.
Root directory of the path to be crawled (supports wildcards).
Literal root directory of the path to be crawled.
The machine-specific unique identifier which identifies the current host system.
Maximum crawl depth. Default is 512.
Maximum items to crawl. Default is 4,294,967,295.
The number of minutes to allow crawl to run.
The date/Time when crawl will be stopped if it has not already completed.
Job does not expire automatically.
Optional job name.

maml:alert.maml:para: The Start-FileSystemCrawl is simpler to use than this command, since it takes care of calling Get-LocalMachineIdentifier and Register-FsVolumeInfo as neeed.

command:example.maml:title: Register volume info and start crawl job to run no more than 3 hours.
Register volume info and start crawl job to run until 5AM, if necessary.
Register volume info and start job to crawl 2 different paths.
